{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 26-year-old female who recently gave birth and is now presenting with headache and seizures. Mild hypertension was present during pregnancy, but proteinuria was not seen. The CT scan shows a parasagittal hematoma. Based on these findings, the most likely diagnosis is hypertensive intracranial hemorrhage. Eclampsia is a possibility, but the absence of proteinuria makes it less likely. Sagittal sinus thrombosis and pituitary apoplexy are less likely based on the clinical presentation and imaging findings.", "answer_choice": "B"}
